result.execSummary:
The defendant Amos Maurice Wesley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample. Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges by 11-27-2022. Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.
- Restitution set at ZERO.

- NO CONTACT with SMW.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to case 20CF919; STRAIGHT TIME
Court advised that under 18 USC Section 922(g)99) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amos Maurice Wesley

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amos Maurice Wesley in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Amos Maurice Wesley in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amos Maurice Wesley appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Court finds State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing hearing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to case 20CF919, straight time.  

-Provide DNA sample;
-No contact wtih SMW.
-Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges by 11/27/2022.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment;  
-Restitution set at ZERO 


*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised that under 18 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Notice of Intent to Pursue Postconviction Relief

Defendant Amos Maurice Wesley in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Amos Maurice Wesley in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amos Maurice Wesley appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
Received and Filed. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Received and Filed. Addendum to Plea Questionnaire

Defendant Amos Maurice Wesley in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a sentencing.  Due to court calendar congestion, case is unable to be heard today.  Case is adjourned to 5-23-22 at 10:00 am by zoom.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Amos Maurice Wesley in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Amos Maurice Wesley in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amos Maurice Wesley appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Amos Maurice Wesley in court with attorney Robert W Peterson.  Defendant Amos Maurice Wesley in custody.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amos Maurice Wesley appeared by video means with Attorney. Defense motion to dismiss argued and State. Court ordered to dismiss Domestic Abuse Assesments enahncer (973.055(1)). Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
